title: Specifying arguments types on lambda gives this error here.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body: ### Toml ```toml [package] name = "gen" version = "0.0.1" edition = "2021" [dependencies] serde = "1.0" serde_yaml = "0.9" ``` ### Code ```Rust use std::collections::BTreeMap; use std::env; use std::fs; fn main() { let v : Vec = env::args().collect(); if v.len() == 2 { read_file(&v[1]); } else { panic!("wrong number of arguments"); } } fn read_file(file_name: &String) { let file = fs::File::open(file_name).expect("no file with this name"); let x : BTreeMap = serde_yaml::from_reader(file).expect("parse error"); println!("{:?}", x); println!("{:?}", x["constants"]); } fn parse_constants(x: &BTreeMap) -> BTreeMap { let c = |(x, y): (&String, &String)| { f((x, y)).expect("failed to parse") }; x.iter().map(c).collect() } fn f((x,y): (&String, &serde_yaml::Value)) -> Result<(String, String), String>{ match y { serde_yaml::Value::String(s) => Ok ((x.clone(), s.clone())), _ => Err(String::new()) } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.2 (9eb3afe9e 2023-03-27) (built from a source tarball) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9eb3afe9ebe9c7d2b84b71002d44f4a0edac95e0 commit-date: 2023-03-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.2 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` I could not test on the other versions, sowyy >///<. ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/region_constraints/mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 0, kind: BrNamed(DefId(0:12 ~ gen[189c]::parse_constants::'_), '_) }) <= '_#8r thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /tmp/rustc-1.68.2-src/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:987:33 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fc2a02b6da9 - ::fmt::hd942f93f90a12975 1: 0x7fc2a033fa0e - core::fmt::write::h3e809fe7db83f902 2: 0x7fc2a02cfe85 - 3: 0x7fc2a02b6b65 - 4: 0x7fc2a02e162f - 5: 0x7fc2a02e12ec - std::panicking::default_hook::h39ec3bc249e5a063 6: 0x7fc29c551035 - 7: 0x7fc2a02e1ffd - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h74d15b4a49499fd9 8: 0x7fc29eaff683 - 9: 0x7fc29eaf2b76 - 10: 0x7fc29c492636 - 11: 0x7fc29ead2386 - 12: 0x7fc29eacdfa4 - 13: 0x7fc29eacddd7 - 14: 0x7fc29ebe2095 - 15: 0x7fc29ebe20fc - 16: 0x7fc29ebdf72e - 17: 0x7fc29ebdf6a9 - 18: 0x7fc29c49b007 - 19: 0x7fc29eb9f10b - 20: 0x7fc29eb998c8 - 21: 0x7fc29ebe9724 - ::regions 22: 0x7fc29ebf11b5 - 23: 0x7fc29eadd18d - 24: 0x7fc29ebed17e - ::tys 25: 0x7fc29eb7dd73 - 26: 0x7fc29ebf1254 - 27: 0x7fc29eadd18d - 28: 0x7fc29ebed17e - ::tys 29: 0x7fc29e8d8d0c - 30: 0x7fc29e8e3bd9 - 31: 0x7fc29ea15d8a - 32: 0x7fc29ea7e248 - ::report_closure_arg_mismatch 33: 0x7fc29ea8dfd8 - ::report_selection_error 34: 0x7fc29ea9edde - ::report_fulfillment_error 35: 0x7fc29ea8a16c - ::report_fulfillment_errors 36: 0x7fc29c91721f - 37: 0x7fc29c9162d1 -
